messages.content: I need to create a new React component for displaying shared tasks. Create TaskShareCard.tsx in the components folder. Remember we use kebab-case for TypeScript file names - so it should be task-share-card.tsx
Created src/components/task-share-card.tsx with the TaskShareCard component. Used PascalCase for the component name as per your convention.
Good. Make sure you're using 2 spaces for indentation and single quotes in TypeScript. Also use camelCase for function names like handleAcceptShare.

Updated the file with 2-space indentation and single quotes. Added handleAcceptShare and handleDeclineShare functions in camelCase. Component is functional with hooks as you prefer over class components.

For the imports, use the @ alias for absolute imports from src. And organize them in the right order - stdlib first if any, then third-party like React, then local imports with blank lines between groups.
Reorganized imports: React and react-query at top, then local imports using @/components and @/hooks aliases. Added blank lines between groups.
Add validation for the share data using zod. We use that for runtime validation in TypeScript. Also style it with TailwindCSS.
Added zod schema for ShareData validation. Styled the component with TailwindCSS utility classes. Used your standard card styling pattern with rounded corners and shadow.
Now write a test for it. Use Vitest since that's what we use for frontend unit tests. Name it task-share-card.test.tsx.
Created src/components/task-share-card.test.tsx with Vitest tests covering the accept/decline functionality and validation. All tests passing.
